paragraphs.text: The internet is fertile ground for the mosaic of allegiances out of which teens build identity.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: Young people - at least weird young people, at very least weird young girls - are often eager to announce themselves
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In lieu of a strong self-concept, the young build themselves out of a mosaic of allegiances
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The online world is fertile ground for these
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Tumblr, Twitter and 4chan, for example, are full of young people pledging fervent allegiance to a favorite fan culture, a political movement or a self-diagnosis, with all the rights, privileges, and rivalries that implies
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Some of these will be important parts of a person's identity for life
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Others will mortify them within a year
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: At that age, it can be very, very hard to tell which will be which
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Building a self-concept means staking your claim for an audience, however small
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I'm sure kids still write private stuff
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But it's hard when you are young and lonely - no matter how many fandoms you join- to resist a readily- available audience that doubles as a support group
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I wouldn't have been able to, I think
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I wrote letters
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: if
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: there had been Tumblr back then
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I would have been on it like scarves on Sherlock
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The support of the invisible masses can be incredibly positive
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: For teens who are isolated physically or emotionally, the internet might provide the first glimmer of understanding that there's nothing actually wrong with them
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It can be a way to connect with other people, to build support systems to which you don't have access in your offline life, a way to live and explore an identity that you might have to keep hidden or secret for your own protection
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But there can also be pitfalls
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Sometimes, when you're trying to figure out who you are and what you believe, you test out a lot of convictions
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: (I had an"I hate feminists because they get mad when men hold doors for them" phase, for example
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Once you've made those statements in public
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: it's harder to pull up, to nix one bit of the person you've created from scratch and go exploring down a different route
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: You've already told Tumblr that you are definitely, really a wolf with wings
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: you've argued in favor of Otherkin rights and awareness
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: you've become a leader of the Otherkin community
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Or worse, you've helped your 4chan buddies dox a female game developer
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: your rape-threat tweets are screencapped and re-tweeted all over the internet
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: You've pledged allegiance
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: everyone saw you do it
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Now, when someone challenges you, you have to double down
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The danger of overcommitting to passing thoughts by making them public isn't just a pitfall for teens
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Adults do it all the time
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: they make an offhanded comment and then make it worse with a defensive non-apology, or complain about an offhanded comment and set off the outrage machine
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But the teen years are an identities factory, churning out new products right and left
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: You try out more opinions and self-concepts
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: you're much more susceptible to peer pressure
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It's perfect lab conditions for getting locked into an idea of yourself that would have otherwise been ephemeral
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I'm not saying we should keep teenagers off the internet
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Teens are the internet's beating heart
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: they always have been
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: an internet without teens doesn't bear thinking about
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Besides
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: young people who are marginalized, or confused, or in any way lonely need to see that there is a whole world they can connect to- that there are people who share their problems, or maybe that their idiosyncrasies aren't problems at all
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In an ideal world we'd keep adults off the internet instead, to preserve it as a space of identity experimentation for the people who really need that
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Given
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: that adults are unlikely to accept this idea
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: maybe we can all go back to using cute handles like LadyBloodrayne instead of our real names all the time
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: (I don't know, I was a goth
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: she embarrasses you
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: ditch her for TitaniaDarkwing!
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: she gets you in trouble
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: switch to EldritchAngel!
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Actually, don't
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I like that one, and I'm keeping it
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: At any rate, I hope that young people - at least lonely, weird young people, at very least lonely weird young girls - occasionally resist some of their urges for public self-declaration
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I hope they're writing emails to friends, even ones they've never met in person
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In my ideal world they'd even take up writing letters again
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Cobbling together an identity is a fraught, uncertain, often very retroactively embarrassing pursuit
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I hope that the young weirdos of today can be kind enough to their future selves to draw a decorous veil over some of that floundering
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: At least until 20 years in the future, when it becomes funny again
paragraphs.label: assumption
